title: Kane limps off with injury
text:
Harry Kane limps off injured in Tottenham's FA Cup game with Millwall By Nick Lustig Last Updated: 12/03/17 2:51pm Harry Kane suffered the injury in the fifth minute at White Hart Lane Harry Kane could be set for a spell on the sidelines after limping off less than 10 minutes into Tottenham's FA Cup tie against Millwall. 
The Spurs forward collected the ball on the right side of the 18-yard box and was caught by Millwall defender Jake Cooper after delivering a cross. 
Kane's right foot appeared to twist underneath the trailing leg of Cooper and he was quickly treated on the pitch by the Tottenham medical staff. 
Despite their best efforts, the England international was unable to continue and was replaced by midfielder Christian Eriksen, with Son Heung-min moving into a central striking role. Kane was unable to continue and was replaced by Christian Eriksen 
Kane did manage to walk off the pitch and down the tunnel unaided, but his withdrawal will be a major cause for concern for Tottenham manager Mauricio Pochettino. 
The 23-year-old could also be a doubt for England's forthcoming internationals with Germany and Lithuania, with manager Gareth Southgate set to announce his squad on Thursday. 
Kane, who has scored 24 goals in 28 appearances for Tottenham this season, missed just under two months of the season with an ankle ligament injury suffered in the 1-0 victory over Sunderland in September. Also See:
